channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6218] Tasks for producing a 10.10.2 maintenance release.
item.description:
Tracking issue for commits, etc for the 10.10.2 release
Release wiki is at:
http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/DerbyTenTenTwoRelease
item.summary: Tasks for producing a 10.10.2 maintenance release.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The query for backport candidates is:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20DERBY%20AND%20Type%20%3D%20%27Bug%27%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3D%20%2210.11.0.0%22%20and%20fixVersion%20not%20in%20%28%2210.10.1.1%22%2C%20%2210.10.1.3%22%29%20AND%20%28labels%20not%20in%20%28derby_backport_reject_10_10%29%20or%20labels%20is%20null%29
Attaching a diff for the first attempt at creating release notes.

I noticed the following known issues in generating the release notes:

  • the ReleaseNotesGenerator under cygwin creates RELEASE-NOTES.html with inconsistent line-endings (I fixed that by using the cygwin utility dos2unix)
  • the instructions tell one to first circulate release notes, but at that point, the version in JIRA is still the old version.
  • the wiki talks about the filter id, but the instruction box doesn't actually pass that on, so you hit one failure

In addition, I saw the following things which were new to me:

  • the 'incompatibilities' section gets created with the phrase:
    "Derby release 10.10.1.3 introduces the following new features and incompatibilities. These merit your special attention"
    This phrase is not from releaseSummary.xml, but with a bug fix release, it should not say 'new features'.
  • I got the following build error, although apparently the Release Notes were created OK:
    ---------
    BUILD FAILED
    C:\derby\1010\10.10\tools\release\build.xml:167: The following error occurred while executing this line:
    C:\derby\1010\10.10\tools\release\build.xml:522: Unable to delete file C:\derby\1010\10.10\tools\release\jirasoap\target\JiraSOAP-LATEST-jar-with-dependencies.jar
    ---------

I was planning on making the release, but then started wondering about the jdk 1.8, which I didn't have yet, whether it was needed.
Rick confirmed it was needed, and that he had to build an OpenJDK version to make the 10.10.1.1 release (because of the legalities in using prereleases). I looked at what's involved, and it was more than I was counting on.
There fore, I proposed to postpone the release until there were 1.8 binaries available.
See: http://apache-database.10148.n7.nabble.com/10-10-2-release-plans-tt133359.html
The developers community agreed.

Oracle's jdk 1.8 is currently expected to be GA on 3/18/2014.

I updated the 10.10.2 release page wiki https://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/DerbyTenTenTwoRelease with my intentions, including generating and circulating the release notes today.

However, nothing in the release process ever seems to just work completely - in this first attempt of generating the release notes, I hit some limit in JIRA:
C:\derby\10.10\tools\release\build.xml:156: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: JQL query 'project = DERBY AND resolution = fixed AND fixversion in ("10.10.1.4", "10.10.1.1")' failed (com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException: Error occurred during searching: 'You are not allowed to get a result set of more than 200 results. Current search returns 359 results'.)

I'm going to see if I can fix this, any suggestions are welcome...

Commit 1581166 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1581166 ]

DERBY-6218; Tasks for producing a 10.10.2 maintenance release.
checking-in draft 2 for the release notes (temporarily referring to 10.10.1.4)
attaching second draft for the release notes (saying '10.10.1.4)

Attaching a patch and the actual file for the third draft of the release notes.
It has the following changes:

  • now says 10.10.2.0
  • I changed the heading 'Issues' to 'Issues of Special Concern' and moved it to above the more General Bugs list
  • I maintained the split between documentation and test and other bugs. Although this was a manual manipulation, it seemed folks liked this.
  • I changed the category of a couple of test bugs because the fix was in source code, not test.
  • I removed the test bugs. It's attached here as a separate file, which won't get checked in anywhere.
  • I fixed up the release note for DERBY-6209 and DERBY-6383
  • I modified the list of fix versions for DERBY-4280 and now it shows up.

Commit 1582527 from Myrna van Lunteren in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1582527 ]

DERBY-6218; Tasks for producing a 10.10.2 maintenance release.
bumping the version number to 10.10.2.1 after making a release candidate

I created a 'derby' directory in the svnpubsub db region https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/db with revision 5035.
I created a directory for db-derby-10.10.2.0, https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/db/derby/db-derby-10.10.2.0 with revision 5036.
To complete the mirroring of active releases in this area, I added db-derby-10.8.3.0 with revision 5039.

I believe I now need to inform infra to do some magic, to complete the move to svnpubsub, but I'm going to focus on finishing the steps to publish the release first.
